pullRequest.body:
These theorems are used in [Project VD](https://github.com/kebekus/ProjectVD), which aims to formalize Value Distribution Theory for meromorphic functions on the complex plane.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [d7952fcf44](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21015/commits/d7952fcf4404a5c3d10b6a8e4823237d910bc7d4)

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ order_mul`
`+ order_smul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@loefflerd Thanks! I will implement your suggestions. However, we are in the end-of-semester craze right now, so I will probably need a few days.
@loefflerd Dear David, thank you so much for your suggestion that I gladly applied. I was not aware of the `filter_upwards` tactic and will make sure to a) learn it and b) apply it in the future.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.
Thanks for this nice PR! I'm really happy to see that the "MeromorphicAt" stuff is turning out to be useful. I've suggested a few ways the proofs can be streamlined.

I strongly recommend the `filter_upwards` tactic for almost any filter-related goals:
```suggestion
  rw [order_eq_top_iff] at *
  filter_upwards [h'f] with z hz using by simp [hz]
```

```suggestion
  cases' h₂f : hf.order with m h₂f
  · simp [hf.order_of_locallyZero_mul_meromorphic hg, h₂f]
  cases' h₂g : hg.order with n h₂f
  · simp [mul_comm f g, hg.order_of_locallyZero_mul_meromorphic hf, h₂g]
  -- Non-trivial case: both functions do not vanish around z₀
  rw [← WithTop.coe_add, order_eq_int_iff]
  obtain ⟨F, h₁F, h₂F, h₃F⟩ := (hf.order_eq_int_iff _).1 h₂f
  obtain ⟨G, h₁G, h₂G, h₃G⟩ := (hg.order_eq_int_iff _).1 h₂g
  use F * G, h₁F.mul h₁G, by simp [h₂F, h₂G]
  filter_upwards [self_mem_nhdsWithin, h₃F, h₃G] with a ha hfa hga
  simp only [Pi.mul_apply, hfa, hga, zpow_add₀ (sub_ne_zero.mpr ha), smul_eq_mul]
  ring
```

Points to note here:

- `cases` and its cousin `cases'`, applied to a type has several constructors (such as `WithTop`), will generate a branch for each of the possible ways you can make a `WithTop`. So in the second branch of `cases'` we already have, in the context, an `m : ℤ` and a proof that `hf.order = ↑m`; we don't have to mess about with `untop`. 
- The fact that the intersection of two punctured neighbourhoods of `x` is itself a punctured nhd of `x` is already implicit in the fact that `𝓝[≠] x` is a filter; and `filter_upwards` knows this. 
- Probably `MeromorphicAt.order_eq_int_iff` should have its `n` variable made implicit (mea culpa!), since it can be inferred from either side of the `iff` statement. That would give a nicer syntax for the `obtain` blocks.

How much harder would it be to prove `order_smul`, with `f` scalar-valued and `g` valued in a normed space `E`? I suspect the proof would be basically the same; and then it would be a one-liner to deduce `order_mul` from it. Of course the case of scalar-valued functions is clearly the most interesting one, but if we can wring a little bit more generality out of the proofs then we may as well do so.
Resolved with the commit that you suggested below.

Here is a version adapted to the `smul` case; if you're happy with this then apply the change and I'll recommend the PR for merging.
```suggestion
/-- The order is additive when multiplying scalar-valued and vector-valued meromorphic functions. -/
theorem order_smul {f : 𝕜 → 𝕜} {g : 𝕜 → E} {x : 𝕜}
    (hf : MeromorphicAt f x) (hg : MeromorphicAt g x) :
    (hf.smul hg).order = hf.order + hg.order := by
  -- Trivial cases: one of the functions vanishes around z₀
  cases' h₂f : hf.order with m h₂f
  · simp only [top_add, order_eq_top_iff] at h₂f ⊢
    filter_upwards [h₂f] with z hz using by simp [hz]
  cases' h₂g : hg.order with n h₂f
  · simp only [add_top, order_eq_top_iff] at h₂g ⊢
    filter_upwards [h₂g] with z hz using by simp [hz]
  -- Non-trivial case: both functions do not vanish around z₀
  rw [← WithTop.coe_add, order_eq_int_iff]
  obtain ⟨F, h₁F, h₂F, h₃F⟩ := (hf.order_eq_int_iff _).1 h₂f
  obtain ⟨G, h₁G, h₂G, h₃G⟩ := (hg.order_eq_int_iff _).1 h₂g
  use F • G, h₁F.smul h₁G, by simp [h₂F, h₂G]
  filter_upwards [self_mem_nhdsWithin, h₃F, h₃G] with a ha hfa hga
  simp [hfa, hga, smul_comm (F a), zpow_add₀ (sub_ne_zero.mpr ha), mul_smul]

/-- The order is additive when multiplying meromorphic functions. -/
theorem order_mul {f g : 𝕜 → 𝕜} {x : 𝕜} (hf : MeromorphicAt f x) (hg : MeromorphicAt g x) :
    (hf.mul hg).order = hf.order + hg.order :=
  hf.order_smul hg
```

pullRequest.title: feat: establish additivity of MeromorphicAt.order under multiplication of meromorphic functions
